result.execSummary:
The defendant Veronica A Rohr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant may petition the court for expungement upon successful completion of the sentence.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay fine of $1,000.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Perform 40 hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.  May not have contact with Eric Licht, unless otherwise permitted by the agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  May expunge record upon successfully completing probation and satisfying all financial obligations.

Attorney Zachary Brost appeared for the State.  Defendant appears in person pro se.  Agent Deschner appears by phone.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  Hearing on petition to expunge court record.  The court indicates that the defendant has not successfully completed probation based on the memo received from Agent Deschner.  The court denies the defendant's petition to expunge the court record.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Veronica A Rohr, appeared with Attorney Thomas Joseph Torcasso.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  PSI is waived by parties and sentencing arguments are made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 18 months with conditions.   As a condition DE is ordered to complete 40 hours of community service.  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample and notice is given.  Court imposes a fine of $1000 plus costs & DNA surcharge to be paid during supervision.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  No contact with Eric L. unless permitted by the agent.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Veronica A Rohr, appeared with Atty Ted Kmiec specially for Atty Thomas Joseph Torcasso.  Clerk: PT
Atty Kmiec states case is resolved and requests a date for plea & sentencing on behalf of Atty Torcasso as parties will be waiving PSI.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
